meanings.definition: Coaxing or persuading someone through flattery or compliments.
meanings.sent1: She was blandishing her friend to borrow her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys blandishing his way into getting what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The cat was blandishing the owner for extra treats by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: The salesman was blandishing the customer with sweet words to make a sale.
meanings.sent5: The magician was blandishing the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.

meanings.definition: The act of using flattery or compliments to persuade someone.
meanings.sent1: Her blandishing of the teacher earned her extra credit.
meanings.sent2: The politician's success was attributed to his skillful blandishing.
meanings.sent3: The dog's blandishing of the family for more playtime was quite effective.
meanings.sent4: The artist's blandishing of the critics led to glowing reviews.
meanings.sent5: The student's blandishing of the principal resulted in a special award.
